title: No odor control

text:
The ARM & Hammer Clump & Seal Platinum Cat Litter has become a staple in our home. What stands out immediately is how excellent the clumping is — truly one of the best we’ve used. Because it forms such solid, tight clumps, it works beautifully with our automatic litter box. The better the clumping, the smoother the machine runs, and this litter delivers every time.

When the box is cleaned regularly, the odor control is impressively low, keeping the space fresh and manageable. Like any litter, if it’s forgotten for a few days, the smell does creep in — but that’s more of a universal truth than a flaw of this brand. Same truth with the weight, par for the course.

It can get a little messy and slightly dusty, but honestly, that’s par for the course with most litters. The dust level here is mild enough that it doesn’t bother us or our cat, and the performance more than makes up for it.

What really seals the deal is the value. For the quantity you get, this is one of the best-priced litters out there, especially considering how well it clumps and how compatible it is with automatic systems. It’s absolutely worth the money, and we’ll keep buying it.

Highly recommend for anyone with an automatic litter box or anyone who wants strong clumping without breaking the bank.
date: Revisado en los Estados Unidos el 10 de enero de 2026
title: Reliable, Affordable, and Perfect for Automatic Litter Boxes!

text: I’m confused, the first order of this litter I received was dark in color and almost sandy… it seemed to work well so I ordered it again. Tell me why I added the second litter to what I had remaining of the first and it’s a completely different color and consistency?? This second batch I got was more similar to your typical clumping litter, light grey and rocky. I want to know what I’m getting when I buy a product, especially when it comes in an opaque box. The litter works like any other so I’ll go back to my inexpensive one where I know what I’m getting.
